pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a summable family of power series whose elements are non-negative powers of a fixed Hahn series times the coefficients of a formal power series. We will use it to define algebra homomorphisms from rings of formal power series to Hahn series.

---


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
    powerSeriesFamily hx f n = PowerSeries.coeff R n f • x ^ n :=
```
Same everywhere

```suggestion
theorem support_powerSeriesFamily_subset (hx : 0 < x.orderTop) (a b : PowerSeries R) (g : Γ) :
    ((powerSeriesFamily hx (a * b)).coeff g).support ⊆
    (((powerSeriesFamily hx a).mul (powerSeriesFamily hx b)).coeff g).support.image
```

```suggestion
theorem hsum_powerSeriesFamily_mul (hx : 0 < x.orderTop) (a b : PowerSeries R) :
    (powerSeriesFamily hx (a * b)).hsum =
    ((powerSeriesFamily hx a).mul (powerSeriesFamily hx b)).hsum := by
```

I would expect `coeff_sum`, whereas `sum_coeff` would be about the sum of all the coefficients. Maybe this means that `add_coeff` is also the wrong way round.
Compare with https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Coeff.html#Polynomial.coeff_sum
I had thought about changing `add_coeff` but then `sub_coeff` and `neg_coeff` also seem to need the same treatment.  I will do that in another PR.

```suggestion
  smulFamily (fun n => f.coeff R n) (powers x hx)
```

```suggestion
theorem powerSeriesFamily_apply (n : ℕ) :
```
Would be good if `powers` didn't need the `hx` argument, and instead returned a junk value when `x` doesn't have positive order
I will try this in a later PR.

```suggestion
/-- A summable family given by scalar multiples of powers of a positive order Hahn series.

The scalar multiples are given by the coefficients of a power series. -/
```
I think it's surprising enough that it's worth mentioning. I was looking for an `ℕ → R` argument

```suggestion
    powerSeriesFamily hx (r • f) = HahnSeries.single (0 : Γ) r • powerSeriesFamily hx f := by
```

```suggestion
  · intro i hi his
    simpa [PowerSeries.coeff_mul, sum_smul] using his
```
Can you try golfing the other `simp_all` similarly?

```suggestion
  have he : ∃ p ∈ antidiagonal n, ¬(PowerSeries.coeff R p.1 a •
```
